page.title: 20THE AUCTION MARKET
page.content: Years ago{auction markets}were taken in the{streets}of Kirkby Stephen. Fences were fixed at the edges of the pavements so the animals didn't get knocked down by traffic. After every- body had taken their animals home the locals of Kirkby Stephen would sweep sheep and cattle muck up off the streets to spread on their gardens. At the South end of Kirkby Stephen there used to be another{auction {market.}South of the{auction}there is the Croglin Castle Hotel (which is still there now) which was an eating place for farmers.Then opposite the{ {auction}is the railway (which is now closed down) that was used for taking cattle to different counties and farms.The auction market is now at the rear end of Faraday Road.Weekly sales are held on a Monday.Important autumn sales attract large numbers of dealers
